{"step_by_step_thinking": "Clubfoot is a congenital condition, meaning it is present at birth. Document [27] mentions that genetics likely play a role in the development of clubfoot, and a positive family history is noted in many cases. Document [25] also supports this, stating that genetic and environmental factors are involved in the etiology of clubfoot. Document [26] mentions that clubfoot may be associated with specific syndromes and deformities, such as arthrogryposis and spina bifida. However, polio is a viral infection that can cause paralysis and muscle weakness, but it is not mentioned in any of the documents as a cause of clubfoot.", "answer_choice": "C. Polio"}
